result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Howard Earl Stewart

defendant.name: Stewart, Howard Earl
defendant.address: 3418 North Port Washington Road, Milwaukee, WI 53212

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Howard Earl Stewart in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Howard Earl Stewart.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Howard Earl Stewart appeared by phone.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Howard Earl Stewart.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Calendar call held.  Court ordered the stayed warrant vacated.  Atty. Obscherning requests a DPA hearing date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Howard Earl Stewart not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning not in court.  
Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Case set for status conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Calendar call scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Howard Earl Stewart in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Defendant has completed the TAD evaluation and defense is waiting on DPA. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Howard Earl Stewart in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Howard Earl Stewart appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 01.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Howard Earl Stewart in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Brandon Schwebler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Obscherning has not received discovery and an offer and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Howard Earl Stewart in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/12/2022@2:30pm
